articles.description: Follow radio and text commentary as Japan face Argentina in Nantes for a place in the World Cup quarter-finals.
articles.title: Argentina stun Japan in must-win World Cup game - radio & text

articles.description: Watch live BBC Two coverage as Manchester City host Chelsea plus follow updates from four other fixtures in the WSL.
articles.title: WSL: Build-up to Man City v Chelsea, plus Brighton 0-0 West Ham

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound commentary and follow text updates as St Mirren host Rangers, before St Johnstone visit Aberdeen in the Scottish Premiership.
articles.title: Scottish Premiership: Can Rangers avoid third consecutive loss at St Mirren?

articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as India play Australia in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: Cricket World Cup: India v Australia

articles.description: Andy Farrell enters the biggest week of his reign as Ireland prepare for a World Cup quarter-final against New Zealand.
articles.title: 'Irish top pool in style to set up biggest challenge yet'

articles.description: Max Verstappen entered the rarefied realm of triple Formula 1 world champions with a hard-fought second place in the sprint race at the Qatar Grand Prix on Saturday.
articles.title: 'Verstappen as close as it gets to unbeatable'

articles.description: India's Virat Kohli makes a fine catch at first slip to remove Australia opener Mitchell Marsh in their World Cup match in Chennai.
articles.title: 'Kohli comes to the party' with brilliant catch to remove Marsh

articles.description: Leigh Wood completes one of British boxing's great turnarounds as he stuns Josh Warrington with a comeback win in their WBA featherweight title fight.
articles.title: 'A Cinderella story' - Wood's greatest comeback

articles.description: Wayne Rooney leaves his role as coach of MLS side DC United by mutual consent after they fail to make the play-offs.
articles.title: Rooney leaves DC United by mutual consent

articles.description: Head coach Gregor Townsend says "the responsibility is mine" after Scotland crashed out of the World Cup at the hands of a rampant Ireland.
articles.title: 'Responsibility is mine' - Townsend on Scotland exit
